|Title=Know the indications for referring a child to an ophthalmologist.
|Description=None
|Rubric=Management
|Contributors=Elise Launay
|Order=7}}

Refer to ophthalmologist if

* personal or family history: risk factors = ophthalmological examination between 3 and 12 months, even in the absence of warning signs.
* abnormality or doubt on inspection
* abnormality or doubt on screening test
* warning signs
* inability to measure visual acuity (verbal age)

'''IN EMERGENCY if'''

o leukocoria,

o cloudy cornea (glaucoma)

o sudden onset of strabismus

o recent onset of nystagmus

question.question: Refer to an ophthalmologist if
question.option_a: a child has a personal or family history of ophthalmological conditions
question.option_b: a child shows warning signs of ophthalmological conditions
question.option_c: a child has an inability to measure visual acuity (verbal age) and is at risk of ophthalmological conditions
question.option_d: a child has a personal or family history of ophthalmological conditions and shows warning signs of ophthalmological conditions
